blurb: Microsoft's Java-equivalent.
An old-timer still trying to make a comeback.
One of the older languages and a big improvement over C, this language without the extra Microsoft syntax is a great way to get stuff done if you need performance.
If you don't really have a lot of space on the chip you are deploying to, this may be a solution, still try C++ first.
Ensuring that types never change, this language is a large improvement in reducing bugs compared to basic JavaScript.
The language this blog is written in, once you get used to it, things move quickly!
One of the two languages the author hasn't played in yet, From what others have said, this one is a lot like Scala.
Mips is the assembly language of choice in schools, this example is pulled from a homework assignment years ago!
code:
.data
msg1: .asciiz	"Hello mips!"
      .text
main: 
      li $v0, 4		#load print string code
      la $a0, msg1
      syscall

      li $v0 10		#load Exit code
      syscall

blurb: Statically typed and ready to run on most machines because this language runs on the JVM.
Similar to Kotlin (the one right above me), this language is a higher level version JVM language.
As the fourth and final language that runs on the JVM, this one is another higher level one written to be easier to write than pure Java.
As simple as this example is, this one is one that was never used by this author and had to be looked up on the internet.
